text:
Light up an


LED for the first


time
tasks: Gather necessary components (LED, resistor, battery, wires)
Learn about LED polarity and how to identify anode/cathode
Calculate appropriate resistor value for your LED and power source
Build a simple circuit on a breadboard to light the LED
Test the circuit and troubleshoot if needed
Experiment with different color LEDs and resistor values
Document your steps in a Google Drive doc and share its url as an evidence
resources: SparkFun's 'How to Use a Breadboard' tutorial: https://learn.sparkfun.com/tutorials/how-to-use-a-breadboard
YouTube video: 'How To Light an LED - The Basics' by Paul McWhorter: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OzoPxvlM2qE
description: The quintessential first step in electronics! Learn the basics of circuits and components by lighting up an LED.

tasks: Learn about different wire gauges and types
Understand wire stripper markings and size indicators
Practice stripping various wire sizes safely
Learn to avoid nicking the internal wire
Strip and prepare wires for different connector types
Practice creating consistent strip lengths
Document your practice results with photos
resources: Adafruit's Guide to Wire Stripping: https://learn.adafruit.com/wire-stripping
description: Master the essential skill of properly stripping wires for electronics projects, ensuring clean connections and safe assembly.

tasks: Choose an appropriate beginner electronics kit
Inventory all components in the kit
Read and understand the assembly instructions
Follow the step-by-step build process
Test the completed circuit
Troubleshoot if necessary
Document the build process and final result
description: Build confidence and practical skills by completing a structured electronics kit project.

tasks: Learn soldering safety and workspace setup
Practice tinning the soldering iron
Learn proper temperature settings
Practice making solder joints on practice boards
Learn to identify good vs bad solder joints
Practice desoldering techniques
Complete a simple soldering project
description: Master the fundamental skill of soldering - essential for creating permanent electrical connections.

tasks: Understand breadboard layout and connections
Learn about power rails and distribution strips
Practice component placement and orientation
Build simple circuits using jumper wires
Learn to read breadboard diagrams
Practice neat wire management
Document your first successful breadboard circuit
resources: SparkFun's How to Use a Breadboard: https://learn.sparkfun.com/tutorials/how-to-use-a-breadboard
description: Master the use of breadboards for prototyping and testing electronic circuits without permanent connections.

text:
Get a circuit


wrong and try


again
tasks: Build a circuit that doesn't work as expected
Learn to use a multimeter for troubleshooting
Document the symptoms of the failed circuit
Research potential causes of failure
Apply systematic debugging techniques
Successfully fix the circuit
Document lessons learned from the experience
description: Learn valuable troubleshooting skills by experiencing and overcoming circuit failures.
